title: India to have 150 fintech unicorns with combined $500 billion valuation by 2030: report
description: The report, titled ‘Indian Fintech Journey from Evolution to Mega Public Listings’, released on Tuesday, forecast that the combined revenue of Indian fintech firms will surge to $260 billion by the end of this decade, up from $20 billion currently. This growth would be driven by increasing consumption, deeper market penetration and advancements in artificial intelligence, it said.
content: India is projected to have 150 fintech unicorns with a combined valuation of $500 billion by 2030, with segments like payments, lending, insurtech, wealthtech and neobanking poised for multifold growth, a report by investment banking firm JM Financial and venture capital firm Beams Fintech Fund said.The report, titled ‘Indian Fintech Journey from Evolution to Mega Public Listings’, released on Tuesday, forecast that the combined revenue of Indian fintech firms will surge to $260 billion by the end of this decade, up from $20 billion currently. This growth would be driven by increasing consumption, deeper market penetration and advancements in artificial intelligence, it said.The payments industry, on the heels of the success of the Unified Payments Interface (UPI), is expected to lead the fintech boom in India, with transaction values projected to reach around $11 trillion by 2030. By the end of 2024, the number of UPI QR codes is anticipated to grow from 202 million in 2022 to 317 million, while point-of-sale (PoS) terminals are expected to rise to 8.6 million.Further, in the next five to six years, lending book size is projected to increase 6.6 times to $300 billion, the report noted. Also, gross written premium in insurtech is expected to touch $15 billion, and the assets under management by wealthtech platforms are likely to surge four times to $237 billion.
